DataElement.preferredName: Biopsy Prior Therapy Field Inclusion Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Term to signify whether a biopsy was done on an area within or outside of a prior treatment field.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy._The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy.:The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.

Concepts.definition: Prior action or administration of therapeutic agents that produced an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.
